level.text: Under ยง21(c) of the Act [ยง36-320(c), D.C. Code, 1981 ed.], the Office shall conduct the investigation of claims as is necessary to determine all questions concerning a claim including, but not limited to, the following:
The fact and degree of disability;
Whether the claimant is entitled to compensation;
Whether adequate medical care has been provided;
Whether adequate vocational rehabilitation has been provided;
The necessity, character, and sufficiency of any medical aid furnished;
The amount of compensation due an injured employee; and
Whether a change in condition has occurred sufficient to justify a review of a previously rendered compensation order.

The Office may utilize as part of its investigation non-adjudicative fact finding procedures including informal conferences under ยง219 of this chapter to narrow issues, encourage voluntary payment of claims, and encourage agreement between interested parties.
